intro: Agropyron × mucronatum, commonly known as the slender wheatgrass, is a hybrid grass species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its fine, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
